alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 22 at 2:13PM MDT until May 24 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU AND HIGHLANDS, WEST CENTRAL HIGHLANDS AND MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Any low level moisture which seeped westward on a vigorous cold front last night and early this morning will be shunted to the east Tuesday as gusty northwest winds associated with a passing upper trough usher in a drier and more unstable air mass over western and portions of central New Mexico. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau and Highlands, West Central Highlands and Middle Rio Grande Valley from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to around 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 6 to 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands
